The third game in the fantastic creeper world series. It takes the gameplay of the original, and builds on it; interestingly, it gives you all of your old toys pretty quickly. The anti-creeper from the sequel makes a return, and works quite well. The level design was decent, although there were times when I felt it could've used work, and I rarely found it necessary to use more than one control node, with the exception of the timed missions.

The story was the weakest part, having reduced the cast to just two members: Abraxis and his ship's AI. There's some good world building, but I think it could've been greatly expanded upon, and the twist ending was really unexpected, and felt out of place. I'm not fond of stories that retcon their own history. If you want a great story, I'd recommend playing the original, which is still the best in this regard.

I was honestly hoping for a longer experience overall, but there is replay value in the form of custom community maps (still haven't tried it yet), as well as a random map generator which need to be unlocked through the campaign. Something I'd love to see is a massive map, spanning several screens in size, with complex terrain and hidden secrets buried around the map; the only time you excavate anything in game is during the last level.

On the whole, fans of the genre will enjoy this, just don't expect any literary awards. 8/10.

An RTS that's as good as they get.  Instead of fighting individual units that make a bee-line for your core, you fight a substance known as Creep; A liquid substance with physics similar to water and the same goal as Grey-Goo.  For those of you not familiar with Grey-Goo, it is a popular science fiction end of the world scenario, where some type of substance achieves sentience and begins consuming everything it can reach, creating more of itself as it constantly pushes on, eventually driving the planet to extinction or perishing itself.  This is your enemy in the game.  You fight on individual planets by utilizing topography of the land, claiming high points as your base of operation to give you time to build up a defense against the flowing creep, while emitters and spawners constantly create more creep that will slowly fill up the map.  You must constantly push forward with several tower types, while creating supply lines and other resource units to power your towers, so that you can reach the creep's cores and emitters and destroy them to cease the flow.  The game is easy to pick up and learn to play, but some levels can be extremely hard to beat.  I personally took over two hours on a single level because of a small error I made that almost wiped out my entire base, forcing me to start from scratch while the creep had already filled up most of the map.  The game even features a large amount of user made maps and a built in, easy to use level editor so you can make and share with friends and the community.\n\nI highly recommend you get this game.

I also would expect because of the explosion of map possibilities, this might become a mainstay of one of those games you come back to for a distraction from those other games that are not entertaining you at present.  Enjoy, I know | am.\n\nUpdate, I have now played it for 31 hours, and it is surpassing all expectations.
Great new game in the series! There are lots of new units and mechanics to try out. Watch out for the long and challenging levels though.
This game is a very fun one at that. Destroy creeper throughout the universe and discover the true nature of the Loki.\nI've said too much already, go buy the game!!!!

Found the flash games addictive, and saw this for cheap on a sale, figured what the hell. Found it to be worth the £5 or so, but wouldn't want to pay any more than that.\nPlay the flash games first, if you get addictive then come back for this, but don't buy it and expect much more than an updated version of the flash games.
The Best of the Best.

If you looking for a Tower defense game that's not a tower defense, This is the game.\nIt has a good story line, its challenging, and once the story line is done, There lots of pre-made systems with lots of planets, Sure to keep you busy with this game.\nBetter yet! There are Player made maps! Download and play them for lots of new things, or make your own maps and see what kind of chaos you can make.

i got this game today and iv already put 4 hours into , i love tower defence games and this is exactly what i have been looking for. i will damit the screen shots look very daunting but its much easier to understand once you start playing.
This is the best flash RTS I have ever played in my entire life.
love the concept, the game is so addicting :)
Hmm, Strategy game. So, in that case, buy this game right now.
Worthy Game. You wont be done anytime soon.
The campaign is short but there are tons of other maps, not counting the user created maps that guarentee that you will be able to kill as much creeper as you wish.
A fun strategy game that builds on the storyline of the previous two versions of the game.

Fantastically nice game to either play for just 15 minutes to waste some time or sink several hours in to beat some of the harder maps and systems.

+ Campaign with natural tutorials
+ Almost infinite maps available when you unlock systems outside the campaign
+ Map editor, hours of fun making huge maps with creeper spewing from everywhere.
+ Tormented space with very difficult maps, fight tooth and nail to survive.

- Music and sounds can get pretty repetitive and feel a bit low quality, you can use your own music instead though, still enjoyable
- Endgame often don't offer much resistance, once you have survived the initial phase of building (early-mid) it's just a matter of building mortars to clear as much creeper as possible.
Minecraft creepers are better

A brilliant game that proves you do *not* need awesome graphics to have a ridiculous amount of fun.

Its simplicity is what makes this game fun... and the fact that in-game tutorials are built in.

Never played its predecessors but they must have been entertaining to have spawned this third version.

(Before edit, play time was 150-170 hours)

You get one very nice campain.
The game has an integrated map editor and you can play the custom maps made by other players.
There are also two areas with lots of auto-generated maps, some of them very difficult and few of them impossible.

I recomend the campain for those who like tower defense and strategy games.
I recomend the extremly difficult maps for those who like to discover alone how to improve and optimize.

I have not played yet any of the player made maps, so I can tell little about them. I know that you can use scripts and custom images when you create the maps so possibly the comunity maps might be interesting too. You can rate those too and I seen a thriving comunity there :)

Edit:
(08-Oct-2015) Play time: 209 hours

I made two maps, a normal map and one with scrips.

The programming language used in scrips is based on reverse polish notation" concept:
- you put the values into the stack and the operand afterward on top of them
- the operand will combine the top elements (these are consumed)
- the result is being placed back to the top of the stack

The concept is very different from normal programming languages.
They say on the wiki that you do not have to be a programmer to learn this language.
I say this is true for any programming language.
And after you learn it
date: you are a programmer. Not an experienced or profesional one
recommended: but a programmer nevertheless.\n\nRegarding the maps: I made them for myself
hoursPlayed: as hard as possible. Some people do not like hard maps.\nI will continue occasionally to make maps inbetween other games.\nI avoid playing custom maps to avoid being influenced by their ideas."

10/10

If you've played Creeper World before, know that this is an excellent sequel. If you liked it before, you'll love this.

If not, then you're also in for a treat! CW is very, very good. People compare it to tower defence, but I usually describe it as a computer network fighting a liquid. The lines you see in the screenshots are the links between your units - if a unit becomes disconnected, it won't get resupplied and will eventually become defenceless. So, keeping supply lines going is incredibly important. The other thing is that your primary enemy is a corrosive purple liquid - it has no AI whatsoever, it just flows following the terrain. (Or sometimes it moves in other ways - the more scripted maps can have it behave in stranger ways.) The third thing is that terrain is everything. Perhaps the best defence in this game is just a really high wall... until the creeper overflows it!

This is a game about attacking, not defending however. Pushing forwards, often uphill, can be very tricky because most of your units can't attack upwards, and the creeper naturally flows down on top of you. Then you have to handle beach landings, and spore towers that will dump creeper right in your base, and runners that stun your units, and then all of these at the same time, uphill, with a time limit, along with all kinds of one-off scripted challenges too!

Later in the campaign you'll unlock units that can modify the terrain (slowly) and let you build a series of stepping stones above the creeper, or build walls to protect your home, or produce helpful anti-creeper"
date: or send supply ships to bridge between islands
recommended: or try to push the creeper away with force fields
hoursPlayed: or all sorts of other cool things. The fact that it's so freeform lets you find a style that's comfortable. I'm a big fan of terrain fiddling myself.\n\nSeriously
voteText: this game has so many original ideas
helpfulPercent: and it's executed really well. Perhaps not the prettiest of games
votesHelpful: but it's very clever
votesTotal: and it'll make you feel clever when you finally conquer a map that's taken you hours. I can't recommend it highly enough."

reviewText: This game is amazing because you can either be lazy and take forever to complete missions or focus on your strategy and try to blast your way though the creeper. Its addicting and the challenging levels are pretty fun to beat!
This game has taken my heart and soul by storm, I played the flash games quite a bit and when I found this I had to buy it. Great stratgy/time eater game.
This is a fantastic game for those who enjoy planning and incremental building.
Super addicting strategy with great mechanics and craploads of maps
Still one of the best games I ever played!
This game is addictive. You think you'll play for a few minutes and next thing you know its 3am . I just played 13 hours in one go.
Much yes. So much replay. Stories kinda O_o but whatevs, I'll go with it. Replay eternal.

This is possibly one of my favorite games in my library. I get bored with games very easily, but this is one of the few that I can spend hours in and never even notice the time. The campaign itself has hours upon hours of gameplay, not to mention the extra level packs and the hundreds upon thousands of fan-made levels. This game is well worth the price.\n\nThe Creeper World series has always drawn me back again and again and it never disappoints everytime I plant my command center and begin the battle against that awful blue goop.

One of those 'great anytime' sort of games. Campaign, random gen maps, many different strategies to win with, pacing you can choose in most maps. If you ever liked games where you are constantly fighting the horde, this is an RTS that takes that concept to the core. Here the horde isn't zombies or aliens, here it is a gelatinous fluid that spreads at a constant rate from various emittors. That is it. Shoot it, blow it up, build up walls to contain it or protect yourself with, it will eventually flood the map higher than the highest mountains if you do not stem the tide. It is relentless. This game tickles a specific 'kill the horde' thing I have in my head every now and then and does so in a memorable way. I already have plenty of time in the non-Steam version before unlocking it on Steam, I'm playing on here simply to gather achievements on top of playing normally but I'm not playing specifically for the achievements. This game is simply a great time-filler between other games, like right now I'm bored of various FPS's and RTS's in my library and just want some straight up fun. Not too simple, not overly complex, the graphics are functional and have their own aesthetic I appreciate. Don't see it go on sale often but even full price I got my money's worth with several dozen hours in already on the non-Steam version. It also runs on Linux. What else can you ask for?
Very interesting game concept.\nIt can still become repetitive if you like to take your time on each level :)
One of steam's hidden gems!

Your awesome, I'm awesome, this game is AWESOME.  Go ahead, think you shouldn't buy this game.  But seriously, this game will end all things that aren't awesome.  Awesome+awesome(awesome)=Too much Awesome.

Definitely one of my favorite games. The perfect game for me, and maybe you. The campaign is decent, but the best time is to be had on the player created maps. If you like RTS games you should definitely try this out.
Is Awesome time waster! Buy Now!

I always love a good genre-bendre and this one is interesting. Instead of just building towers along a route to mow down enemies, you build movable towers to gradually beat-back the spread of purple goop. You have to manage power and supply lines as well. Quite fun.

Graphics aren't stellar but they don't need to be. Som games need to look good and some don't. FPS and other action-oriented games all almost always more fun if they look better. Some games don't benefit much from a visual upgrade.

After playing more-recent shooters, it's really hard for me to play through (for example) Dark Forces. One of my favorite games of all time but it's such an eyesore that it's hard to play. CW3 could look as nice as Starcraft 2 but that wouldn't make it a better game; it would just make it a better-looking game.

They could maybe charge a few extra dollars if it looked like SC2 but then I'd complain that it wasn't worth the price.

Good game, CUSTOMIZABLE CONTROLS, fun (but skippable) story.

Creeper World might have the least appealing trailer ever; the presentation is unrefined at best.  Hoever, this is a true diamond in the rough.  Based on other reviews, it sounds like most folks share my opinion.  This game takes the best parts of the tower defence, real time strategy, and sim games and remixes them into something greater than the sum of its parts.  Throw an engaging narrative on top of that, and I am a happy gamer.  If you really aren't sure whether this game is for you, check out the online version... it started as a freely distributed browser game, and several early versions are still out there.

Fantastically nice game to either play for just 15 minutes to waste some time or sink several hours in to beat some of the harder maps and systems.

+ Campaign with natural tutorials
+ Almost infinite maps available when you unlock systems outside the campaign
+ Map editor, hours of fun making huge maps with creeper spewing from everywhere.
+ Tormented space with very difficult maps, fight tooth and nail to survive.

- Music and sounds can get pretty repetitive and feel a bit low quality, you can use your own music instead though, still enjoyable
- Endgame often don't offer much resistance, once you have survived the initial phase of building (early-mid) it's just a matter of building mortars to clear as much creeper as possible.
A really great game. It's one i keep coming back to.

Probably the best game that I've played this year! Bought it while it was on sale, and it turned out to be something that I'd pay the full price and would still get way over content/cent I'd get from most other titles.

+ The variety of units is just enough for the game to always have a choice of what to do next and how to complete particular map.
+ Rather interesting story mode, followed by tons of randomly generated maps, AND some really challenging ones made by alpha testers.
+ Map generator - even more content!
+ Map creator and user-created maps.

- Only one song for the entire game, playing on every level. It's quite long, dynamic and really great, and takes really long to get old, but after 60+ hours I wish there was more music.
- Game really has only a couple ways to challenge you - Creeper and Digitalis with Runners. Most of the challenge comes from the map itself. Some story and player maps have very diverse objectives and obstacles, so if you got bored, go to Alpha Sector or Colonial Space.
- Some maps can take you up to 2 HOURS to complete!
- If you are a completionist type of guy - good luck to you XD ! I doubt I'll ever complete any sector besides story one.

Seriously, this game is awesome and you should buy it. If you like strategy games. that is.
R.I.P\nSocial Life\nYou won't be missed
A creative and incredibly addictive take on tower defense. Lots of different towers, upgrades, and mechanics allow for lots of different strategies. Buy it.

Absolutely loved this game. If you are a tower defense fan: get this game. If you're a TD fan looking for something unique and challenging: get this game.\n\nCreeper World 3 has everything that makes a great TD game: ingenuity, difficulty, fun, and complexity without being overwhelming. I didn't delve much into the content beyond the campaign (which is a TON) because I just really don't have the time anymore. What I can say is that for the price the game is an absolute must for anyone into challenging strategy and/or TD games. Check it out - you won't regret it!

A game has to be very good to keep me coming back to it, as I'm getting old and fussy.
This one did just that It's like the Dev's took the Tuc cheese Sandwich and squeezed it into a game cause you just got to have one more.

So if you have time too burn I give you a great push in this direction you will not be disapointed.
An interesting kind of puzzle game.
really fun.
Simple but interesting mechanics, fighting a 'liquid' based enemy forces you to fight in curious ways. If you want a challenge, try to avoid terraforming much.
realy liked the game

Really amazed at the depth of this game. It makes you think, and is quite challenging, even early on.

Graphics aren't the greatest, and there are not a lot of tool tip explanations for things.

That being said, the graphics aren't the draw, it's the tactical/strategic challenge, the depth of that challenge.

I haven't been this impressed with a game like this in ages.

It's...not really a Tower Defense game...it's....more like an RTS game with TD elements.

Buy it :)
it is addictive and fun. it takes time to finish a mission but i don't mind. the map editor is fun and i wanted a map editor for this game
wow
fun to play
Great game for a great price. Do not have to have the best of computer to run the game. I would recommend for anyone looking for a TD or even a really good time killer.

Awesome.  Most fun you can have with 1980 graphics.\n\nAfter you've won on the campaign one of the regions you can explore is called tormnented space.  Lots of the missions there are close to impossible;  rarther annoying if you have even minor OCD.

A simple battle of attrition.  I do wish that Creeper expands faster as each mission goes on, but the story is suprisingly engaging and there's a real challenge in trying to speed run the missions.  There is also plenty of content to enjoy, and plenty of varied units, each with their own pros and cons.  Missions are as easy or hard as you want to make it.  The music is very fitting and fantastic.  The graphics are simple and adequate.  Pick it up if you're a fan of tower defense games and games similar to that genre.

Good game. I was quickly hooked on the campaign but then I got to Tormented Space which seemed impossible. I went to the prospector zone and it had many planets that were all too easy until I ran across Molreport which again was impossible. Seems like the planets are either too easy or impossible once you finish the short campaign which ends without a word of explanation.

I have only seen a small fraction of the Arc Eternal universe so I don't know if there are going to be more challenging planets. I'm beginning to think that like most games that rely on user created maps, that there is a lot of tedium. You'll have to look hard to find challenging games once you finish the short campaign.

There isn't a lot of variety in the buildings. If you zoom in close there isn't anything to see. There isn't much in the way of detailed tool tips. That's too bad because specific information could make a difference. I enjoyed terraforming my way into enemy territory but building shields is faster and less complicated. You just build millions of generators and then shield your way into the deep stuff and rip out the bad things by the roots. Bombers, straffers and guppies are there but they are rather tedious and much less effective. I didn't see people putting up lots of experience nodes to capture that might encourage you to level up your ore and AC carrying capacity in order to launch a big D day type invasion.

I would highly recomend this game at the sale price especially if the professional types are going to build a longer campaign that is as delightful as their earlier campaign but this is not up there in quality like Mount and Blade or Kerbal Space Program. If their mission was to show those corporate types that they could do as good a job as any big studio, they didn't succeed. If Stardock is the MacDonalds of gaming then these guys are the Chinese takeout that opened on the corner with the crispy vegetables, delicious sauces and suspiciously slippery meat.
I really loved the game. Played it a lot before it released on steam and I keep coming back to it.
The in browser games were awesome and this is awesome too, You should buy it, but wait untill it goes down to 2$

This was honestly a surprising buy. It's fairly simple to start out learning, but difficult to master. I love this game. I haven't beat it, but I plan to play many more hours. One of my favorite purchases on Steam.
It's very satisfying obliterate the creeper! I had to by CW2 after playing this. I will gladly buy CW4 if they make it.

I've followed the creeper series since it began and each game has been rewarding and worth each hour spent playing it. If you are looking for a strategy game to burn hours on with a degree of challenge and occasional thinking outside the box, this is your game. Also, there is player content and countless other implemented game types which keep you playing the game even after you've beaten the core element.

100/10\n\nThis is the best strategy game I have played in ages. It has a unique idea, it's well thought through and brilliantly executed. The whole game is a slow build against the liquid-like enemy, and as such is difficult to lose. Instead you'll find yourself stuck trying to figure out how to push forward in certain scenarios, or overwhelmed before you can get a foothold on your position. The story is nothing special, mostly just flavour text to give some kind of structure to the missions, but the game itself has been put together so well that you'll forget they even thought they needed a story. Cannot recommend enough.

Good execution, easy to play despite old graphics style. Unfortunately a little boring already after the first few worlds ... maybe there's a concept that's more challenging later in the game but for now it's just building as much as you can. I'd still recommend it for more casual players and/or people that are looking for a time waster. Runs well on linux.

Creeper World 3 is very similar to Creeper World 1.

For those who haven't played Creeper World 1:
You need to build and defend a little city from a relentless flow of blue goo whose physics behaves like water. You can vaporize it with lasers, blow it up with mortars, hit it with air strikes, and even terraform the landscape to trap it--for a while. The catch is that all of these things require energy, and you've got to find a balance between building up your energy supply while also building up your defenses. If you don't have enough of one or the other, the never-ending flow of creeper will slowly overwhelm your city. It's an excellent strategy game that combines defensive thinking and resource management.

For those who have played CW1:
This is mostly the same game, but with a story-mode and plenty of new levels. There's also a few new toys to play with, like ways to generate your own anti-creeper
date: ways to terraform the terrain, and even ways to fly energy packets to remote areas that are not connected to your network. The creeper also has a few new tricks including digitalis" which spreads faster and is harder to destroy but is limited to pre-defined paths
recommended: and "runners" which are little mobs that can temporarily disable your structures.\n\nI could knock the game for not being more innovative
hoursPlayed: but I liked CW1 enough that I thoroughly enjoyed having a similar experience again."

in my opinion this game is one of the legends of its kind.

you can simply call it a tower defense, but it extends your experiance with its uniqe defence/offence style.

you try to defend yourself from unstopping evil organic fluid that flows all around the map in a very nice storyline. after finishing it, you challenge player/beta tester or developer made maps.

i have just finished the storyline and writing this with its excitement. i believe i will play this game for many more hours. even i will try the stroy line again and again with different strategies.

if yu like to play as a turtle this game will satisfy your needs

i strongly suggest this game if you both like tower defence and rts. watch some youtube videos about the game and decide

Look, this game is not for everyone but if you like this style of game I feel like this is the gold standard.  Basically you play a series of maps that involve building power generation and defenses to fight off the invading creeper (basically purplish goo) and destroy their spawn points.  Every level more or less follows this model and yet every one feels unique.  The main mode stiches these maps together into a story about the origin and goals of the creeper which I also found light-hearted and entertaining.  I highly recommend it.
Simple, well paced, and addicting. Good work Knuckle Cracker!
A fantastically put together game with simple to grasp foundations, but an ever pressing difficulty and super satisfying wins.

I always love a good genre-bendre and this one is interesting. Instead of just building towers along a route to mow down enemies, you build movable towers to gradually beat-back the spread of purple goop. You have to manage power and supply lines as well. Quite fun.

Graphics aren't stellar but they don't need to be. Som games need to look good and some don't. FPS and other action-oriented games all almost always more fun if they look better. Some games don't benefit much from a visual upgrade.

After playing more-recent shooters, it's really hard for me to play through (for example) Dark Forces. One of my favorite games of all time but it's such an eyesore that it's hard to play. CW3 could look as nice as Starcraft 2 but that wouldn't make it a better game; it would just make it a better-looking game.

They could maybe charge a few extra dollars if it looked like SC2 but then I'd complain that it wasn't worth the price.

Good game, CUSTOMIZABLE CONTROLS, fun (but skippable) story.
Fun, addictive, different. Well worth it!

I must say this game hides quite well behind apparent dated graphics and, let's be honest, pretty ugly UI. It grows on you however, as a long form strategy game unlike any other I've played before. I also found myself enticed by the story and the imagination therein. Some missions are challenging, but when you get past those hurdles you realise it's fair difficulty, and most of the time it's simply your build order that might need revising for that mission.\n\nIt's somewhere between Total Annihilation and Starcraft. The only thing that really bothered me was the music.

I got this game at the end of the year, and I think it is my favorite game I have played on steam out of the entire year. I'll be honest I got this game mostly because of its cheap price and it is tagged as an RTS, but this game has really suprised me, I have never played a game quite like this and I will probibly even after completeing the campaign, continue playing this into the new year.
Only issue i had was the short campaign
really ♥♥♥♥in awesome!
Awesome game

Creeper World is not what I expected, in a good way. It has the feel of a tower defense game, but instead of fighting hordes of ever increasingly strong creatures, you're fighting 'the blob' as I like to call it. If you're not careful, you are overwhelmed easily. It may seem simple, but the levels keep advancing and getting more tactical, while the core of the game remains. I highly recommend this game!

Very enjoyable game, while it was a little grindy at times as a whole enjoyed each level.\nI don't understand how anyone could complain about the price, there is a crapload of content in this, literally hundreds of non-campaign maps.\nAnother well rounded game for the series.

Easily one of the best RTS game out now. Great campaign gameplay and online custom maps.  Also has a highly customizable random maps mode with infinite map options.

This game is awesome!! Most of the time it takes 45-100 minutes to beat a single level, so you will need some time.

I love this game! It has the right amount of challenge as a variety of ways to win.
Theres so many ways to tackle each map. You need to decide where you base goes, decide which node goes first, decide if you want to go for the risky quick kill, or the slow but steady.

Played the first 2 iterations of this game.  Loved them both and had to get this one.  Got it as a standard purchace from the official website.  Got it on steam too.\nAlthough the gameplay may seem repetitive, the novel enemy and (infinitely) varied terrain makes this my goto game for lunch breaks or late night casual mission type play.

PROS:
+ fun relaxing gameplay
+ story is really engaging
+ hundrers of maps after finishing the main story
+ doing things your way. There is a few different ways to approach the problems and most of them will work. All videos I watched solved the maps in a different way I did. This is satisfying

CONS:
- story is text-based. It could use some voice acting
- graphics are very simple and not really descriptive. Units feel like random shapes

NOT PROS/CONS:
+- most of the maps play the same way. You have to set a perimeter using your resources the best you can and then kill the creeper back. Once you set your perimeter you have a guaranteed win. Its just a matter of patience. The game play is what gets this game such high score reviews, so im not sure this is a bad thing per se. I also had to restart a few maps a few times during the first part... so it makes you think a different approach at least a little :)

great game fun and lots of time can be put into it. my hours on here dont really represent how much i have played. i bought it from their site and have play all three multiple time. however the player made maps are the downside unless u want to spend several hour trying to get more than 10 mins into one lvl. since there is no way to sort based on difficulty like in previous versions i tend to avoid player made maps becuase it ends up making you never want to play this game again. have fun :D
